DataElement.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Cancer Greater Than or Equal To Age 55 Years AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group for persons 55 years of age or older based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for differentiated thyroid carcinoma, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Greater Than or Equal To Age Fifty Five Year Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary, or follicular carcinoma. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the thyroid gland and shows extensive evidence of follicular cell differentiation.  According to the nuclear features of the malignant follicular cells, it is classified either as papillary or follicular carcinoma.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Age Fifty Five Year Stage Grouping
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.:A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.:A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2020-12-15 TL released. 11/29/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma 55 Years and Older American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma stage for patients 55 years and older defined according to the AJCC 8th edition criteria._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IVB Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IVB Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: 55 years and older: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IVB Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: 55 years and older: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IVA Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IVA Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: 55 years and older: T4b, Any N, M0. T4b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading prevertebral fascia or encasing the carotid artery or mediastinal vessels from a tumor of any size. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IVA Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: 55 years and older: T4b, Any N, M0. T4b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading prevertebral fascia or encasing the carotid artery or mediastinal vessels from a tumor of any size. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage III Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage III Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: 55 years and older: T4a, Any N, M0. T4a: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve from a tumor of any size. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: 55 years and older: T4a, Any N, M0. T4a: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve from a tumor of any size. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3a/T3b, Any N, M0). T1: Tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T2: Tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T3a: Tumor measuring more than 4 cm in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T3b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles (sternohyoid, sternothyroid, thyrohyoid, or omohyoid muscles) from a tumor of any size. N1: Metastasis to regional nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3a/T3b, Any N, M0). T1: Tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T2: Tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T3a: Tumor measuring more than 4 cm in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T3b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles (sternohyoid, sternothyroid, thyrohyoid, or omohyoid muscles) from a tumor of any size. N1: Metastasis to regional nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0/NX, M0); (T2, N0/NX, M0).  T1: Tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T2: Tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. N0: No evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Differentiated Thyroid Gland Carcinoma 55 Years and Older AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0/NX, M0); (T2, N0/NX, M0).  T1: Tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. T2: Tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid. N0: No evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis. NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
